abstract: U.S. sales in January fell 49 percent for General Motors, about 40 percent for Ford and 32 percent at Toyota.
snippet: U.S. sales in January fell 49 percent for General Motors, about 40 percent for Ford and 32 percent at Toyota.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT — New-vehicle sales in the United States fell 37 percent in January to one of the lowest levels in half a century, and though automakers said the market was unlikely to get much worse, they were bracing for most of 2009 to be just as bad.

headline.main: Auto Sales Start 2009 at an Abysmal Pace
headline.print_headline: Automobile Industry Suffers Worst Month in Nearly 27 Years
